emails.snippet: Important details inside - everything you need for best experience Hi Learner, Your seat for the Generative AI Mastermind Challenge is confirmed! We're excited to have you with us for the
emails.body:
Important details inside - everything you need for best experience

Image
[https://img.mmdocdn.com/mailmodo/image/upload/ar_740:233,c_crop/v1761570344/editor/p/19c02973-d61f-4a7f-85a2-9a963906ce28/f36f6369146ad4b8708d254f6c381ac5_dwlvri.jpg]

Hi Learner,

¬†

Your seat for the Generative AI Mastermind Challenge is confirmed!


We're excited to have you with us for the Generative AI Mastermind, an event
over Saturday & Sunday (14th & 15th February) to dive deep into the applications
of Generative AI!¬†


Here's what's happening:

 * DAY 1 - ¬†10 AM - 7 PM EST: 14th February
 * DAY 2 - ¬†10 AM - 7 PM EST: 15th February

Click here to view the full Schedule - Here [https://link.outskill.com/C109S]

¬†

CRITICAL: Complete these 3 actions now

¬†

1. Join the private community
All session links and resources shared here only.

üëâ Join the WhatsApp Community [https://link.outskill.com/IFFL]

2. Block your calendar immediately
This isn't optional. Your future depends on these 16 hours.

üëâ BLOCK YOUR CALENDAR [https://link.outskill.com/C109C]

3. Submit your automation requirements
We'll build YOUR specific solution during the live session.

üëâ FILL YOUR AI PLAN HERE [https://forms.gle/555sEMJPiRbNqHeA7]

üéÅ Want to invite friends or colleagues? ¬†
Share this link with them & ask them to fill up the form HERE
[http://referral-global.outskill.com/].

¬†

Reply "CONFIRMED" so we know you're serious.
Team Outskill

¬†

PS: You are receiving this email because you have registered for the program by
Outskill

Instagram
[https://img.mmdocdn.com/mailmodo/image/upload/editor/constants/social/color/default/instagram.png]https://www.instagram.com/outskillcom/

Linkedin
[https://img.mmdocdn.com/mailmodo/image/upload/editor/constants/social/color/default/Linkedin.png]https://www.linkedin.com/school/outskillcom/

emails.snippet: Hi Grace looks good! two highlight points 1. there are three critical stages they have opted-in but not scheduled -- requires intake specialist attention they have scheduled but not yet spoken with the
emails.body:
Hi Grace

looks good!

two highlight points

1. there are three critical stages

   1. they have opted-in but not scheduled -- requires intake specialist 
   attention
   2. they have scheduled but not yet spoken with the intake specialist -- 
   requires intake specialist attention
   3. they are scheduled but missed the appointment -- requires intake 
   specialist attention

2. the spreadsheet is good and helpful - thank you
please advise on how we can align the status in the spread sheet to the 
status in the pipeline. statuses are, i believe: 

   - new
   - in progress
   - marketing qualified
   - scheduled
   - consulted
   - sales opportunity
   - closed - won
   - closed - lost

3. please share your first draft of the intake form


*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and 
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message 
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.

emails.snippet: Dear Matthew, I hope this email finds you well. This is Vitali from the Account Helpdesk. I understand that you are being constantly prompted to enter a token from the app to maintain your WiFi
emails.body:
Dear Matthew,


I hope this email finds you well.



This is Vitali from the Account Helpdesk. I understand that you are being constantly prompted to enter a token from the app to maintain your WiFi connection.



Normally, you do not need to constantly enter a token from the app to continue using WiFi. Once you have registered your device using the authentication code, it should have instant access without needing to re-enter the code each time.



To get this sorted out, please try the following steps:



1. Forget the network: Go to your device's WiFi settings, select the network, and choose "Forget this Network." Then reconnect and enter the token one more time to establish a fresh lease.



2. Disable "Private WiFi Address" (MAC Randomization): Some devices rotate their ID for privacy. If your device changes its "identity," the system thinks it‚Äôs a new guest.



3. Check date and time: Make sure your device‚Äôs date and time are set correctly, as incorrect settings can make tokens invalid.



If the steps above do not resolve the issue, please contact your local centre team at Yorkville, who will be happy to assist with troubleshooting. You can reach them by email at Toronto.Yorkville@regus.com<mailto:Toronto.Yorkville@regus.com> or by phone at +1 416 921 5000.

Should there be anything further we can assist you with, then please do not hesitate to raise a query through the Help section of your online account.



Best regards,



Vitali F.

Account Helpdesk

iwgplc.com



New! Our virtual assistant is now live on your online account ‚Äì Just log in, use the Chat button and save time getting immediate help for any questions directly.


The information contained in this e-mail (including any attachments) is intended only for the personal
and confidential use of the recipient(s) named above. If you are not an intended recipient of this message,
please notify the sender by replying to this message and then delete the message and any copies from
your system. Any use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this message by unintended
recipients, is not authorised and may be unlawful.

emails.snippet: Hey Shane! From my understanding that 6% fee is its own fee. They operate entirely separately from Seeker, they just happen to be one by the same parent company which is why there's an intersect.
emails.body:
Hey Shane!

From my understanding that 6% fee is its own fee. They operate entirely separately from Seeker, they just happen to be one by the same parent company which is why there‚Äôs an intersect.

We are choosing to not activate Tokyo just yet. We have some levers to pull on already and are sticking to the plan. This will be one to activate in the coming months.

Thanks!


Michael Bou Doumit
Director of Sales & Marketing



Aspire Infusions Inc.

1200 Aerowood Drive, Unit 47, Mississauga, Ontario, CA, L4W 2S7

Email: michael@aspireinfusions.com<mailto:michael@aspireinfusions.com>

www.aspireinfusions.com<http://www.aspireinfusions.com/>

From: Shane Sequeira <shane@aspireinfusions.com>
Date: Monday, February 9, 2026 at 10:26‚ÄØAM
To: Michael Bou Doumit <michael@aspireinfusions.com>, Sy Umachandran <sy@aspireinfusions.com>
Cc: Kristin Lumsden <Kristin@aspireinfusions.com>, Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
Subject: RE: Seeker Cannabis | Agreement review

Hi Michael,

Please see attached. Thanks!

For Tokyo Smoke, just to confirm for the 6% fee, would it be on top of the Seeker 8% fee? So effectively a total of 14%?

Best Regards,
Shane

From: Michael Bou Doumit <michael@aspireinfusions.com>
Sent: February 6, 2026 9:03 AM
To: Sy Umachandran <sy@aspireinfusions.com>; Shane Sequeira <shane@aspireinfusions.com>
Cc: Kristin Lumsden <Kristin@aspireinfusions.com>; Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
Subject: Re: Seeker Cannabis | Agreement review

Hey Sy & Shane,

Attached is a contract for a buying group with 650 retail stores and growing across Canada with about 300+ in Ontario.

Here‚Äôs a high level breakdown:
What it is:

  *   National retail access program for independent cannabis stores

  *   No upfront fee; operates via LP partnerships

  *   Optional access to Tokyo Smoke (~60 stores) as a separate channel
Why it matters:

  *   Gives us controlled access to Ontario independents we don‚Äôt already work with

  *   Current wellness assortment is thin, creating white space for our portfolio

  *   Useful lever to drive velocity on slower-moving SKUs and build broader portfolio momentum

  *   Provides store-level sales data, improving visibility and decision-making (they process the data and package it - includes competitor data)
How we‚Äôd use it:

  *   Selectively onboard priority stores (not forced to go wide)

  *   Leverage monthly promos + email support for incremental lift

  *   Sampling and education remain in-house (no loss of brand control)
Commercial terms:

  *   Seeker Collective fee: 8% (per contract)

  *   Tokyo Smoke access: 6% fee (optional, separate)

  *   Billing: One consolidated monthly invoice paid to Seeker Collective

  *   Payment terms: Net 30

  *   Term: 180 days, auto-renewing

  *   Exit: 60 days‚Äô written notice
Big picture

  *   Low operational friction, moderate cost

  *   Primary upside is distribution access + velocity support

  *   Risk is limited; commitment is short and controllable

If you have any questions, please let me know. If we‚Äôre good to go, we‚Äôd need a signature to move forward please.

Thanks,


Michael Bou Doumit
Director of Sales & Marketing



Aspire Infusions Inc.

1200 Aerowood Drive, Unit 47, Mississauga, Ontario, CA, L4W 2S7

Email: michael@aspireinfusions.com<mailto:michael@aspireinfusions.com>

www.aspireinfusions.com<http://www.aspireinfusions.com/>
From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca<mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>>
Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 at 4:30‚ÄØPM
To: Michael Bou Doumit <michael@aspireinfusions.com<mailto:michael@aspireinfusions.com>>
Cc: Kristin Lumsden <Kristin@aspireinfusions.com<mailto:Kristin@aspireinfusions.com>>
Subject: Re: Seeker Cannabis | Agreement review
Hi Michael

I edited so that Sy / Shane can sign. I do recommend sending them a master license agreement. I will send a 'master agreement' later this week.


Matthew AJ Levine
Barrister & Solicitor

Matthew AJ Levine

On Mon, Feb 2, 2026 at 10:45‚ÄØAM Michael Bou Doumit <michael@aspireinfusions.com<mailto:michael@aspireinfusions.com>> wrote:
Hey Matthew,

Hope you‚Äôre well.

Attached is an agreement with a buying group called Seeker Cannabis.

For context, they are a group made of over 650 retail stores across Canada. They‚Äôve come together to work through data deal program at a collective level rather than individually. We‚Äôre looking to sign on with Seeker to continue growing our distribution points and store velocity.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,


Michael Bou Doumit
Director of Sales & Marketing



Aspire Infusions Inc.

1200 Aerowood Drive, Unit 47, Mississauga, Ontario, CA, L4W 2S7

Hi Max

https://nrc.canada.ca/en/support-technology-innovation/nrc-irap-support-intellectual-property.
i will send a short note. My understanding is that this is the best
starting point, and then there may be provincial funding.

what about overall. when do you want to talk to the patent people?


*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.




On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 12:23‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

> Hi Matthew,
>
>
>
> Have looked into the government funding and seems that anything that‚Äôs
> available is for large companies and the loan amounts are aggressive.
>
>
>
> Do you have any ideas?
>
>
>
> Max Hill, C.E.T
>
> Mascore Helical Piles
>
> 905-807-4389
>
>
>
> *From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
> *Sent:* Monday, February 9, 2026 12:15 PM
> *To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
> *Subject:* Re: New Project
>
>
>
>
>
> Hey Max
>
>
>
> When you have time, please let me know where things are at on your side
> and any additional info I can informally review.
>
>
>
> I would be confident in working on the government funding.
>
>
>
>
>
> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>
> Barrister & Solicitor
>
>
>
> This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
> is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
> in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.
>

>
>
>
>
>
> On Mon, Jan 12, 2026 at 12:11‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:
>
> I haven‚Äôt looked into the grant money that would be available for this but
> will.
>
>
>
> I would need some time to think about this.
>
>
>
> Have been thinking of ways to create a product that is new and novel and
> believe we have some decent idea.
>
>
>
> You plan is great.
>
>
>
> Give me some time to look into grant money. Please do not work on this
> anymore until I get back to you.
>
>
>
> I have enough info to push this forward for now.
>
>
>
> Max Hill, C.E.T
>
> Mascore Helical Piles
>
> 905-807-4389
>
>
>
> *From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
> *Sent:* Monday, January 12, 2026 12:06 PM
> *To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
> *Subject:* Re: New Project
>
>
>
> Hi Max
>
>
>
> the patent lawyers who I know best are litigators but I do know some
> people who do product development and will reach out.
>
>
>
> I believe there may be government money available - have you looked into
> that at all?
>
>
>
> I see the next steps as:
>
>    - *1. Legal Scoping*: counsel reviews the existing (U.S.) patent and
>    scopes a design mandate focused on avoiding infringement under Canadian
>    law. The scope and cost of this work will depend whether the goal is:
>
>
>    - (a) to avoid infringing the existing patent (i.e., design-around), or
>       - (b) to create something patentable by Mascore itself (i.e.,
>       inventive and novel under the *Patent Act*).
>
>
>    - *2 ‚Äì Technical Development*: The product designer works within
>    specified parameters to generate technical outputs, i.e. designs, models,
>    and prototypes to achieve (a) or (b)
>    - *3 ‚Äì Legal Review*: counsel reviews the technical outputs and
>    provides a follow-up opinion or informal assessment confirming whether the
>    resulting design achieves (a) or (b)
>    - *4 ‚Äì Filing & Prosecution (if pursuing a patent strategy)*: If the
>    objective under Step 1 includes creating patentable subject matter, a
>    separate workstream is initiated for preparation and prosecution of
>    Mascore‚Äôs own patent application.
>
> what do you think of the above?
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>
> Barrister & Solicitor
>
>
>
> This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
> is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
> in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> On Fri, Jan 9, 2026 at 12:30‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:
>
> There is a US company that owns a patent on a unique deep foundation
> product.
>
>
>
> It is technically a helical pile, but it is modified and has a continuous
> flight added to it that pull down concrete during installation making the
> foundation much stronger. Attached is the brochure for reference.
>
>
>
> Also attached is the Canadian and US patent.
>
>
>
> My thoughts are:
>
>
>
>    - The patent drawing is technically different from what they actually
>    produce, although similar. The patent shows a helical shape plate with 2-3
>    revolution where what they actually build is a single revolution helix
>    plate.
>    - We build a similar product already without a helix plate. See
>    attached drawing.
>    - Need to figure out a way to prove this isn‚Äôt ‚Äúnovel‚Äù
>    - What type of modification can we make to it to make our own novelty?
>    - An American company produces this and has plans to bring it to
>    Canada. We‚Äôd like to stop this by competing with it.
>
>
>
> I understand you earn a patent lawyer, but do you have any contacts?
>
>
>
> Please let us know your thoughts.
>
>
>
> Max Hill, C.E.T
>
> Mascore Helical Piles
>
> 905-807-4389
>
>
>
> *From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
> *Sent:* Friday, January 9, 2026 11:11 AM
> *To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
> *Subject:* Re: New Project
>
>
>
> Hi Max
>
>
>
> very interested. please send more info.
>
>
>
> (i'm not a patent lawyer, as you know.)
>
>
>
> happy new year
>
>
>
>
>
> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>
> Barrister & Solicitor
>
>
>

> On Thu, Jan 8, 2026 at 9:12‚ÄØAM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:
>
> HI Matthew,
>
>
>
> Hope you are well.
>
>
>
> I have a new project I am working on that involved patent expertise.
>
>
>
> There is an existing product in our market that we would like to start
> offering that is patented.
>
>
>
> We would like to build a similar product without infringing or having
> ourselves covered in the event of a legal action.
>
>
>
> Is this something you can help us with?
>
>
>
> If so, I will provide further details.
>
>
>
> Max Hill, C.E.T
>
> Mascore Helical Piles
>
> 905-807-4389
>
>

emails.snippet: Hi Max I have a draft. I think it would be good for you to review and then we can consider next steps. The most relevant provisions are 8 and 10. Especially 8(b) and 8(e). 8(b) sets out the baseline

emails.snippet: Why automation fails when ownership and sequence aren't clear. Hi Matthew, Quick reminder that tomorrow, February 11 at 12:00 PM ET, I'm hosting a short Legalboards Academy session: Before You
emails.body:
Why automation fails when ownership and sequence aren‚Äôt clear.

Email

Hi Matthew,

Quick reminder that tomorrow, *February 11 at 12:00 PM ET* , I‚Äôm hosting a short Legalboards Academy session:

*Before You Automate*
The three things every law firm must fix first

Automation fails when ownership, sequence, and visibility are unclear. This session breaks down what needs to be fixed before adding anything new.

We‚Äôll cover:

‚Ä¢ why automation adds friction in real firm workflows

‚Ä¢ what needs to be clear before automating anything

‚Ä¢ how to spot hidden workflow issues early

This is not a tool demo.
It‚Äôs about how work actually moves inside small and mid sized firms.

*Save your seat:*
https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_5T8uo0dBRyKhpstRB2KrxA?utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=email&utm_source=sendgrid.com ( https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_5T8uo0dBRyKhpstRB2KrxA?utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=email&utm_source=sendgrid.com )

If you want to apply this to your own firm, you can book a short walkthrough here:
https://legalboards.com/schedule-a-call/?utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=email&utm_source=sendgrid.com ( https://legalboards.com/schedule-a-call/?utm_source=legalboards_academy&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=before_you_automate_last_call&utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=email&utm_source=sendgrid.com )

See you tomorrow,

emails.snippet: Hey Matthew! Heard back from legal at TD. They insist on taking out ALL of 3.4 (a,b,c,d). And 8.2. At this point I think we do it and move ahead to show LL. I don't see any other way and am
emails.body:
Hey Matthew! 
Heard back from legal at TD. They insist on taking out ALL of 3.4 (a,b,c,d). And 8.2. 
At this point I think we do it and move ahead to show LL. I don‚Äôt see any other way and am guessing this comes up all the time with people like me doing CSBFP‚Ä¶.. right? Ha. 

I also have been advised to change these by franchisor:

Cap on Operating expenses: We tried to have the increases limited to that of CPI increase. Landlord would not agree to any cap. We will not get this changed
Audit right won‚Äôt happen (guessing this is 4.5?)

Almost there (I think??) ugh. Thanks for any advice or to just change this. I am really anxious to get a redline in front of LL‚Ä¶. Supposed to take possession March 1! LOL. I am cutting it close. 

Thanks and let me know received and how your schedule looks :) 
CR

> On Wed, Feb 4, 2026 at 7:19‚ÄØPM Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>> wrote:
>> Home now and was able to look at it. So they want to exclude TD language, plus take out all of 3.4B. Does this essentially take us down to first version, or worth following this advice and keeping the rest, you think? Hopefully you can have a look in AM and we can get this thing sent. Thanks and have a good evening!
>> Chris
>> 
>> 
>>> On Feb 4, 2026, at 4:10‚ÄØPM, Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Walking down the street in cold but wanted to get this to you
>>> 416-270-9601
>>> 
>>> 
>>> Begin forwarded message:
>>> 
>>>> From: "Fiumara, Robert" <Robert.Fiumara@td.com <mailto:Robert.Fiumara@td.com>>
>>>> Date: February 4, 2026 at 3:42:14‚ÄØPM EST
>>>> To: Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>>, "Thana, Tisanth" <Tisanth.Thanabalasingam@td.com <mailto:Tisanth.Thanabalasingam@td.com>>
>>>> Subject: RE: 601 Yonge Lease with legal review
>>>> 
>>>> Ôªø
>>>> Hey Chris, there is no need to call out TD, in fact there should not be a mention of TD as if you complete your financing at any point with another Financial Institution it would make that section invalid.   
>>>>  
>>>> The point that needs to be deleted is the what you have as B.    that section needs to be removed completely.
>>>>  
>>>> Robert Fiumara I Area Manager, Business Banking (Remote Strategy) TD Business Banking I 100 Wellington Street West, 30th Floor, Toronto, Ontario, M5K 1A2
>>>> M: 647-448-7435
>>>>  
>>>> From: Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>>
>>>> Sent: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 3:34 PM
>>>> To: Thana, Tisanth <Tisanth.Thanabalasingam@td.com <mailto:Tisanth.Thanabalasingam@td.com>>
>>>> Cc: Fiumara, Robert <Robert.Fiumara@td.com <mailto:Robert.Fiumara@td.com>>
>>>> Subject: Fwd: 601 Yonge Lease with legal review
>>>>  
>>>> CAUTION: EXTERNAL MAIL. DO NOT CLICK ON LINKS OR OPEN ATTACHMENTS YOU DO NOT TRUST
>>>> ATTENTION : COURRIEL EXTERNE. NE CLIQUEZ PAS SUR DES LIENS ET N'OUVREZ PAS DE PI√àCES JOINTES AUXQUELS VOUS NE FAITES PAS CONFIANCE
>>>>  
>>>> Hey Guys-
>>>> Ok, I have a new draft from Lawyer that we hope will be acceptable to your credit risk folks. If this is no good, we have a more aggressive backup version, which I am worried won‚Äôt fly with LL. This hopefully will be enough: Strikes out the language that appear to be genuinely incompatible with TD/CSBFP interests. 
>>>> Possible to have an expedited look? Appreciate the help here with back and forth. And hey if this works out I look forward to opening several more stores with you all!
>>>> Chris
>>>>  
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> Begin forwarded message:
>>>>  
>>>> From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca <mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>>
>>>> Subject: Re: 601 Yonge Lease with legal review
>>>> Date: February 4, 2026 at 3:07:23‚ÄØPM EST
>>>> To: Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>>
>>>>  
>>>> second document. Id suggest this version
>>>>  
>>>>  
>>>> Matthew AJ Levine
>>>> Barrister & Solicitor
>>>>  
>>>> This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.  
>>>>  
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> Begin forwarded message:
>>>>  
>>>> From: Chris Roop <roop.christopher@gmail.com <mailto:roop.christopher@gmail.com>>
>>>> Subject: Re: 601 Yonge <https://clicktime.symantec.com/15xVSdQUNSoeWuxS59wHC?h=2ebeMGXFht1SAcoyo8jTerBzk9o8LY1uyiw_JsJ-AI8=&u=https://www.google.com/maps/search/601%2BYonge?entry%3Dgmail%26source%3Dg> Lease with legal review
>>>> Date: February 3, 2026 at 12:22:20‚ÄØPM EST
>>>> To: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca <mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>>
>>>>  
>>>> Hi Matthew-
>>>> As mentioned, I sent lease to lender (TD) for final review before sharing with LL. Seems they want us to go much further on the two clauses marked as problematic as related to CSBFP program. I asked for exact clarity on what needs to come out and have pasted response below. I feel weird striking it myself without running through you. Can you please have a look, let me know if it makes sense (no choice, it seems), then strike as part of final redline. 
>>>> I will then do my best to summarize all changes and share with LL. Fingers crossed, ugh. 
>>>> Thank you. Note from bank here:
>>>>  
>>>> Good morning Chris,
>>>>  
>>>> I hope you are well. 
>>>>  
>>>> Thank you for your continued support throughout this process.
>>>>  
>>>> Regarding the lease, I wanted to discuss two specific clauses that present challenges for our agreement:
>>>>  
>>>> - Section 3.4 ‚Äì Leasehold Improvements: The clause states, "All Leasehold Improvements shall immediately upon installation become the absolute property of the Landlord, free and clear of any liens or encumbrances." The following needs to be removed: the entire section 3.4 (a, b, c, d). We need to reference the property address in the General Security Agreement, and this clause prevents us from doing so.
>>>>  
>>>> - Section 8.2 ‚Äì No Financing by Tenant of Leasehold Improvements: The clause states, "The Tenant shall not create any lien, mortgage, charge, conditional sale agreement or other encumbrance in respect of its Leasehold Improvements." Removing this clause would allow us to secure the leaseholds, which is necessary for our agreement.
>>>>  
>>>> You are requesting financing on the leasehold improvements, but these clauses prevent you from doing so. 
>>>>  
>>>> Thank you for your attention to these matters. If you have any questions or need further clarification, please let me know. I look forward to working together on this.
>>>>  
>>>>  
>>>>  
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> If you wish to unsubscribe from receiving commercial electronic messages from TD Bank Group, please click here <http://www.td.com/tdoptout> or go to the following web address: www.td.com/tdoptout <http://www.td.com/tdoptout>
>>>> Si vous souhaitez vous d√©sabonner des messages √©lectroniques de nature commerciale envoy√©s par Groupe Banque TD veuillez cliquer ici <http://www.td.com/tddesab> ou vous rendre √† l'adresse www.td.com/tddesab <http://www.td.com/tddesab>
>>>> 
>>>> NOTICE: Confidential message which may be privileged. Unauthorized use/disclosure prohibited. If received in error, please go to www.td.com/legal <http://www.td.com/legal> for instructions.
>>>> AVIS : Message confidentiel dont le contenu peut √™tre privil√©gi√©. Utilisation/divulgation interdites sans permission. Si re√ßu par erreur, pri√®re d'aller au www.td.com/francais/avis_juridique <http://www.td.com/francais/avis_juridique> pour des instructions.
>>>> 
>> 
> <601-603 Yonge Lease - 1001162998 Ontario Corp. o.a. KaleMart redline ML 04Feb2026.docx>

emails.body:
Thank you for contacting us.

Your query has been received and assigned case number C-3177980-Q9Y2.

If you wish to provide additional details, please reply to this email.

We shall get back to you as soon as possible.

Did you know that the answer to many questions can be found in your online account?
Simply visit our website, login and you can:

  *   Review, download and pay invoices
  *   View your statement of account
  *   Set up or amend your payment method
  *   End your agreement
  *   Request your retainer return
  *   Book meeting rooms and day offices
  *   Find thousands of locations worldwide
  *   Manage your company and contact details
  *   Use our Help section for further information


The information contained in this e-mail (including any attachments) is intended only for the personal
and confidential use of the recipient(s) named above. If you are not an intended recipient of this message,
please notify the sender by replying to this message and then delete the message and any copies from
your system. Any use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this message by unintended
recipients, is not authorised and may be unlawful.

On Tue, Feb 10, 2026 at 2:23‚ÄØAM Sara Levine <salevine@telus.net> wrote:

> How is it going?

>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> On Mon, Feb 2, 2026 at 1:48‚ÄØPM Sara Levine <salevine@telus.net> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Ok I can talk this week.
>>>> Just took a 2 second look.  Looks like a potentially great opportunity
>>>> if they send you clients.
>>>> Yes need to name the relationship -  the term ‚Äúpartner‚Äù is wrong word.
>>>> Unless it is actually meant to be a partnership?
>>>> Services definition is very vague.  Not sure if the services are legal
>>>> services or not?  That needs to be clear and if not, how to ensure no
>>>> reliance on legal advice.
>>>> The SOW is not attached - No Appendix 1.
>>>>
>>>> I‚Äôve not got experience entering into anything like this so I would
>>>> seek legal advice from a senior partner somewhere with actual experience.
>>>> Compliance risks could include obvious partnership liability risks but also
>>>> advertising and payment compliance.
>>>>
>>>> I never like a deal that agrees to get paid when they get paid and also
>>>> gives them full rights to write down your bill or offer discounts or
>>>> whatever deal to the client, and no duty to collect promptly.  Need to
>>>> flesh out that piece.
>>>>
>>>> More when we chat.

>>>>

>>>>>
>>>>> id like to know your big picture thoughts plus how you suggest
>>>>> managing the specific risks.

emails.body:
I think I am agree to hire you as business lawyer.
Sent from my iPhone

On Feb 9, 2026, at 9:03‚ÄØPM, marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com> wrote:

Ôªø Hi Matthew
Thank you responding to my email. In order to hire you what I have do what kind of documents I have to sign also I would like to know how much I pay in order to retain you, please let me know.
Thank you
Marjan
Sent from my iPhone

On Feb 9, 2026, at 5:40‚ÄØPM, Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca> wrote:

Ôªø
Hi Marjan

In a nutshell, these are some of the initial questions we would conclusively answer once we start working.

I can tell you now that: you purchased the shares. The sales agreement has a number of relevant provisions. Your friend is right that asking for the employment contracts is one specific next step.

I'm obligated to say that the above is not legal advice. I cannot provide legal advice or act as your business' lawyer until there is an agreement between us.

Best regards


Matthew AJ Levine
Barrister & Solicitor

This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.



On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 3:22‚ÄØPM marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>> wrote:
That is email I want to share with you
Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Kristi Kanitz <kristi@flagshipsoftware.com<mailto:kristi@flagshipsoftware.com>>
Date: February 7, 2026 at 12:29:26‚ÄØPM EST
To: marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>>
Subject: Questions to ask the lawyer:

Ôªø 1. Did you purchase the shares of the business or the assets?

2. What does the sale agreement say about the current employees?

Find out from the previous owner:  Did the current people that work there sign employment contracts? If so, where are the contracts?

3. Should you have the current employees sign new employment agreements? If so, what consideration should be offered (you have to give them something to get them to sign)? Keep in mind that even signing the new agreement doesn't mean they start a probationary period.

Find out how long each of the employees has been there. That will tell you what kind of severance you will be responsible for if you decide to terminate them.

Kristi

--

emails.snippet: FINTRAC imposes an administrative monetary penalty on Century 21 Heritage Group Ltd. FINTRAC announced today that it has imposed an administrative monetary penalty on Century 21 Heritage Group Ltd.
emails.body:
FINTRAC imposes an administrative monetary penalty on Century 21 Heritage Group Ltd.
-----------------------------------------------------------------

FINTRAC announced today that it has imposed an administrative monetary penalty on Century 21 Heritage Group Ltd. Following a compliance examination, this real estate brokerage with locations in Thornhill, Alliston, Newmarket, Richmond Hill, Bradford, Hamilton, Simcoe, Milton and Kingston, Ontario, was imposed an administrative monetary penalty of $148,912.50 on December 10, 2025, for non-compliance with Part 1 of the _Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act_ and associated Regulations.

News release: https://fintrac-canafe.canada.ca/new-neuf/nr/2026-02-10-eng
Public notice: https://fintrac-canafe.canada.ca/pen/amps/pen-2026-02-10-eng

To unsubscribe from the list, send a message to List-liste@fintrac-canafe.gc.ca: mailto:List-liste@fintrac-canafe.gc.ca?subject=Unsubscribe with ‚ÄúUnsubscribe‚Äù in the subject line.

FINTRAC is an independent federal government agency, operating at arm‚Äôs length from police, law enforcement and national security agencies. Its mandate is to receive, analyze, assess and, where appropriate, disclose information to assist in the detection, prevention and deterrence of money laundering, terrorist activity financing, sanctions evasion and threats to the security of Canada.

24th floor, 234 Laurier Avenue West, Ottawa, Canada K1P 1H7
Government of Canada

>>> Hi all,

>>> Thanks again for your time today. Quick recap of what we‚Äôve heard, and

>>> *What we‚Äôve heard*
>>>
>>>    - You‚Äôre building institutional digital asset flows on Fireblocks

>>>    this to support licensing and ongoing compliance.

>>>    manual work and false positives,* with strong controls (roles,
>>>    approvals, audit trail).
>>>    - Preference is for a* group-wide risk policy* you can map across
>>>    jurisdictions, while still accounting for local regulatory expectations
>>>    where needed.

>>>
>>>    - Elliptic‚Äôs holistic screening approach (cross-chain/cross-hop) to *avoid
>>>    chain-by-chain scanning and minimise unnecessary investigations*.

>>>    jurisdiction).
>>>    - Fireblocks integration workflow: *risk scores in Fireblocks with
>>>    deep links to Elliptic* results, plus export/API options for audit
>>>    and reporting.
>>>

>> Hi all,

>> *What we‚Äôve heard*
>>
>>    - You‚Äôre building institutional digital asset flows on Fireblocks
>>    (custody + payments), with *low volume / high value activity* (min
>>    ~$50k, up to ~$1m).
>>    - The book is predominantly stablecoins (eg USDT on Tron plus
>>    Ethereum-based rails), so cross-chain tracing and broad chain coverage
>>    matter.
>>    - You don‚Äôt have blockchain analytics in place today, and you need
>>    this to support licensing and ongoing compliance.
>>    - You want a *clear, auditable screening workflow that reduces manual
>>    work and false positives,* with strong controls (roles, approvals,
>>    audit trail).
>>    - Preference is for a* group-wide risk policy* you can map across
>>    jurisdictions, while still accounting for local regulatory expectations
>>    where needed.
>>
>>
>> *What we covered*
>>
>>    - Elliptic‚Äôs holistic screening approach (cross-chain/cross-hop) to *avoid
>>    chain-by-chain scanning and minimise unnecessary investigations*.
>>    - Risk Engine configuration (exposure thresholds, proximity-based
>>    scoring to curb false positives, and policy design either globally or per
>>    jurisdiction).
>>    - Fireblocks integration workflow: *risk scores in Fireblocks with
>>    deep links to Elliptic* results, plus export/API options for audit
>>    and reporting.
>>
>> *Next steps*
>>

>>    - Freddie will follow up separately on Travel Rule (Notabene) and the
>>    Fireblocks procurement path.
>>    - In the trial, we‚Äôll validate the key outcomes: policy fit, false
>>    positive rate, review workflow, and audit artefacts.
>>

>> Jay

–†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª 2: –Æ—Ä–∏–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—ã —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –Æ—Ä–∏–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—ã —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—é—Ç –≤ —Å–µ–±—è —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ . –≠—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç —Ç—â–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ . –í –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö —Å–ª—É—á–∞—è—Ö –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–∫–ª—é—á–∞—Ç—å —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –±—ã—Ç—å –æ—Å–≤–µ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –æ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞—Ö –∏ –æ–±—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö . –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ—Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–ª–µ–Ω –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –±—Ä–∞–∫–∞ . –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –∏–∑ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ . –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—É–ø—Ä—É–≥–æ–≤ . –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –±—ã—Ç—å –æ—Å–≤–µ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –æ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ–≤—ã—Ö –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è—Ö . ## –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª 3: –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ç—ã –ø–æ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—É –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ü—Ä–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ—Ç—ã. –≠—Ç–æ –ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∏–∑–±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª–∏–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Ä–∞–∑—É–º–µ–Ω–∏–π . –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ . –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –∫ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—É —Å —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–º–æ–º. –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ–±–ª–µ–≥—á–µ–Ω —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è . –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –∏–∑ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º –≤ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Ç –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ —É—á–∏—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è . –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –±—ã—Ç—å –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã–º –∫ –∫–æ–º–ø—Ä–æ–º–∏—Å—Å—É . ## –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª 4: –≠–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—ã —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∞ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º —Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Å—Å–æ–º . –≠—Ç–æ —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–æ —Å —Ç–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —á–∞—Å—Ç—å—é —Å–µ–º–µ–π–Ω–æ–π –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É —É –¥—Ä—É–∑–µ–π –∏ —Å–µ–º—å–∏ . –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø—Ä–æ–º–∏—Å—Å –∏ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ. –†–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª –∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ–±–ª–µ–≥—á–µ–Ω —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é —Ç–µ—Ä–∞–ø–∏–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è . –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –∏–∑ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º –≤ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Ç –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø—Ä–æ–º–∏—Å—Å. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –±—ã—Ç—å –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã–º –∫ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è–º . emails.snippet: How is it going? On Tue, Feb 3, 2026 at 10:52 PM Sara Levine <salevine@telus.net> wrote: Sure. On Tue, Feb 3, 2026 at 9:16 PM Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca> wrote: Would Thursday
emails.body:
How is it going?
On Tue, Feb 3, 2026 at 10:52‚ÄØPM Sara Levine <salevine@telus.net> wrote:

> Sure.
>
> On Tue, Feb 3, 2026 at 9:16‚ÄØPM Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
> wrote:
>
>> Would Thursday evening be doable for you ?
>>
>> M
>>
>>
>>
>> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>>
>> Barrister & Solicitor
>>
>>
>> This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information
>> and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this
>> message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> On Mon, Feb 2, 2026 at 1:48‚ÄØPM Sara Levine <salevine@telus.net> wrote:
>>
>>> Ok I can talk this week.
>>> Just took a 2 second look.  Looks like a potentially great opportunity
>>> if they send you clients.
>>> Yes need to name the relationship -  the term ‚Äúpartner‚Äù is wrong word.
>>> Unless it is actually meant to be a partnership?
>>> Services definition is very vague.  Not sure if the services are legal
>>> services or not?  That needs to be clear and if not, how to ensure no
>>> reliance on legal advice.
>>> The SOW is not attached - No Appendix 1.
>>>
>>> I‚Äôve not got experience entering into anything like this so I would seek
>>> legal advice from a senior partner somewhere with actual experience.
>>> Compliance risks could include obvious partnership liability risks but also
>>> advertising and payment compliance.
>>>
>>> I never like a deal that agrees to get paid when they get paid and also
>>> gives them full rights to write down your bill or offer discounts or
>>> whatever deal to the client, and no duty to collect promptly.  Need to
>>> flesh out that piece.
>>>
>>> More when we chat.
>>>
>>>
>>> On Mon, Feb 2, 2026 at 8:27‚ÄØAM Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
>>> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Hi Sara
>>>>
>>>> how are you?
>>>>
>>>> i've attaching the Andersen agreement.
>>>>
>>>> its just a consulting deal, so basically a client engagement.
>>>> probably number one issue is managing conflicts. they dont have canadian
>>>> clients but clearly i need ot figure out: how i am going to label my
>>>> association with them, whether i can use a non-lawco to contract and
>>>> receive payment, what disclaimers are most important, and how i can perform
>>>> something like a conflicts search
>>>>
>>>> id like to know your big picture thoughts plus how you suggest managing
>>>> the specific risks.
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>>>>
>>>> Barrister & Solicitor
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> 1235 Bay Street, Suite 700, TORONTO, M5R 3K4
>>>> <https://www.google.com/maps/search/1235+Bay+Street,+Suite+700,+TORONTO,+M5R+3K4?entry=gmail&source=g>
>>>>
>>>> T: +1 (647) 598-2598
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information
>>>> and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this
>>>> message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.
>>>>
>>>

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, Thanks for clarifying. Here's where we stand: The tasks in GHL have been completed. Follow-up SMS and email sequences for leads we couldn't reach via call have also been finalized.
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,

Thanks for clarifying. Here‚Äôs where we stand:

   -

   The tasks in GHL have been completed.
   -

   Follow-up SMS and email sequences for leads we couldn‚Äôt reach via call
   have also been finalized.
   -

   I‚Äôm proposing a follow-up sequence for ‚Äúno-show‚Äù leads so we can ask
   them to reschedule. To implement this, I‚Äôll need your help confirming
   whether each lead attended their appointment.

You can check/update attendance here:
Appointments Page
<https://login.soulpepper.com/v2/location/Rw6TfoPhzjwqlVSn6oa8/calendars/appointments?listTab=all>

I‚Äôve also updated our leads report with a new ‚Äústatus‚Äù column. You can
leave a note indicating whether the lead showed or not, so I can start
working with implementing the No Show Follow Up / Appreciation SMS and
Email for those who showed:
Leads Report
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dX6oGKfubFKtlwe2yRxvkDIxLMCcYzqs/edit?gid=526320275#gid=526320275>

Once we have the appointment statuses updated, I can set up the no-show
follow-up automation / Appreciation SMS and Email for those who showed.

Thanks!
Grace

>

emails.subject: New email from Marjor Paniti

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew Thank you responding to my email. In order to hire you what I have do what kind of documents I have to sign also I would like to know how much I pay in order to retain you, please let me
emails.body:
Hi Matthew
Thank you responding to my email. In order to hire you what I have do what kind of documents I have to sign also I would like to know how much I pay in order to retain you, please let me know.
Thank you
Marjan
Sent from my iPhone

On Feb 9, 2026, at 5:40‚ÄØPM, Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca> wrote:

Ôªø
Hi Marjan

In a nutshell, these are some of the initial questions we would conclusively answer once we start working.

I can tell you now that: you purchased the shares. The sales agreement has a number of relevant provisions. Your friend is right that asking for the employment contracts is one specific next step.

I'm obligated to say that the above is not legal advice. I cannot provide legal advice or act as your business' lawyer until there is an agreement between us.

Best regards


Matthew AJ Levine
Barrister & Solicitor

This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.



On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 3:22‚ÄØPM marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>> wrote:
That is email I want to share with you
Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Kristi Kanitz <kristi@flagshipsoftware.com<mailto:kristi@flagshipsoftware.com>>
Date: February 7, 2026 at 12:29:26‚ÄØPM EST
To: marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>>
Subject: Questions to ask the lawyer:

Ôªø 1. Did you purchase the shares of the business or the assets?

2. What does the sale agreement say about the current employees?

Find out from the previous owner:  Did the current people that work there sign employment contracts? If so, where are the contracts?

3. Should you have the current employees sign new employment agreements? If so, what consideration should be offered (you have to give them something to get them to sign)? Keep in mind that even signing the new agreement doesn't mean they start a probationary period.

Find out how long each of the employees has been there. That will tell you what kind of severance you will be responsible for if you decide to terminate them.

Kristi

--
[Flagship Software Logo]        Kristi Kanitz
General Manager

Kristi@flagshipsoftware.com <mailto:Kristi@flagshipsoftware.com>
www.flagshipsoftware.com <https://www.flagshipsoftware.com/>

416‚Äë410‚Äë6357 / 1‚Äë866‚Äë672‚Äë0007 ext 102
emails.subject: Re: Questions to ask the lawyer:

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, Thank you, that all sounds perfect. I'm excited about the opportunity to work together and to get started. Wednesday at 4:00 pm works perfectly. I'll give you a call then. Looking
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,

Thank you, that all sounds perfect. I‚Äôm excited about the opportunity to
work together and to get started.

Wednesday at 4:00 p.m. works perfectly. I‚Äôll give you a call then.

Looking forward to speaking with you.

Best,

Laura

On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 6:24‚ÄØPM Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
wrote:

> Hi Laura
>
> Thanks.  As reviewed on the other thread, what is realistic is that I can
> assign and review your work. We would start off working on files where the
> firm has some financial security from the client. We would work together on
> those files to deliver for the clients.  Then, over time, my goal would be
> to identify specific scopes where it makes sense for you to work directly
> with the client, tho I would still be available to discuss the file with
> you and review your work.
>
> How about Wednesday at 4 or 4.30?
>
> Best regards
>
> Matthew
>
>
> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>
> Barrister & Solicitor
>

emails.snippet: Hi Laura Thanks. As reviewed on the other thread, what is realistic is that I can assign and review your work. We would start off working on files where the firm has some financial security from the
emails.body:
Hi Laura

Thanks.  As reviewed on the other thread, what is realistic is that I can
assign and review your work. We would start off working on files where the
firm has some financial security from the client. We would work together on
those files to deliver for the clients.  Then, over time, my goal would be
to identify specific scopes where it makes sense for you to work directly
with the client, tho I would still be available to discuss the file with
you and review your work.

How about Wednesday at 4 or 4.30?

Best regards

Matthew


*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.

emails.body:
Hi Marjan

In a nutshell, these are some of the initial questions we would
conclusively answer once we start working.

I can tell you now that: you purchased the shares. The sales agreement has
a number of relevant provisions. Your friend is right that asking for the
employment contracts is one specific next step.

I'm obligated to say that the above is not legal advice. I cannot provide
legal advice or act as your business' lawyer until there is an agreement
between us.

Best regards


*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor

emails.snippet: Hi Lino thanks! overall, i think we are getting into the parts of the 'master workflow' that have become hard to standardize and delegate. its like: there is a frame that mostly makes sense Hi
emails.body:
Hi Lino

thanks!

overall, i think we are getting into the parts of the 'master workflow' 
that have become hard to standardize and delegate. its like: there is a 
frame that mostly makes sense



Hi Matthew, 

1. That makes sense I was thinking whoever needs to create the task can do 
it under the section but I agree user-wise that would create unnecessary 
work when they can just pick it from the field. I can absolutely create 
that automation! 

lets give it a try

2. Asana doesn't have an automation where the subtasks change based on the 
section the task is moved into. We can do this: 
- *Option 1:* We create one task template per section (each with its own 
subtasks) and set a rule that when task is moved to Section X ‚Üí Convert 
task to Template X. However, this overwrites the task with the template and 
it will delete the comments, attachments, or custom progress.

- *Option 2:* We create one master task, have all possible subtasks once 
(as we have now), group subtasks by color or prefix: 

üü¶ - Onboarding 
üü© - Opening 
üü® - Maintenance 

Sample subtask: 

üü¶ DRAFT: Engagement Agreement
üü¶ CONFIRM: Engagement Agreement Stored in Clio

3. Sorry abt this, I thought whoever's handling Intake has their own board. 
Let me know if this is something that we need in the future!

Kindly let me know your thoughts. Thanks! 



*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor

is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message 
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.

>>>>>> *From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
>>>>>> *Sent:* February 5, 2026 11:09 AM

>>>>>> Hi Marjan
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Good day. I have the FDD, thank you.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> At a preliminary level, I have questions about how the transaction
>>>>>> was structured, particularly in relation to the franchise agreement that
>>>>>> was entered into and the fee that was paid. To start with, can you confirm
>>>>>> whether a $70,000 initial franchise fee was paid, and whether you were
>>>>>> given an explanation at the time for why the transaction was treated as a
>>>>>> new franchise rather than a transfer or change of control?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Before I can assess whether there is a legal issue to be examined, it
>>>>>> would be helpful to make sure I understand the situation from your
>>>>>> perspective. In particular:
>>>>>>
>>>>>>    -
>>>>>>
>>>>>>    What concern or issue prompted you to reach out now?
>>>>>>    -
>>>>>>
>>>>>>    Who was responsible for day-to-day management of the business at
>>>>>>    the time of the transaction, and how was that role described to you?
>>>>>>    -
>>>>>>
>>>>>>    Were you told that any individual‚Äôs continued involvement was
>>>>>>    expected or required when the deal was completed?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> The reason I ask is that issues involving disclosure and transaction
>>>>>> structure are treated differently from operational or personnel disputes,
>>>>>> and I want to be clear on the factual background.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Once I have that context, we can discuss whether there is a legal
>>>>>> issue worth pursuing and what the appropriate next steps might be.
>>>>>> Best regards
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>> *Matthew AJ* *Levine*
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Barrister & Solicitor

Read our latest newsletter!
͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌  ͏‌ 
View web version
 
Investing insights and lessons learned, just in time to help you plan for the new year.

Hit the ground running with market insights for the year ahead! Learn about common cognitive biases, practical ways to navigate finances across generations, and how stock lending can help you earn additional income on securities you already own.

Plan with perspective: Market insights for 2026
As we kick off 2026, David Sykes, Senior Vice President and Chief Investment Officer, TD Asset Management, leads the conversation on what could be on the horizon for the markets following the ups and downs of the last year.
Listen now
 

My top 5 investing tips for a TFSA, RRSP & FHSA

Dan Kent from Stocktrades offers his top investing tips for these registered accounts, just in time for new contribution room available at the start of the year.
Watch now
 

What is stock lending‚Äîand are you doing it right now?

You‚Äôve probably heard the phrase, ‚Äúmake money while you sleep‚Ä¶‚Äù With the TD Direct Investing Stock Lending Income Program, that‚Äôs not just a saying‚Äîit‚Äôs something you and your portfolio can actually do.
Watch now

How our brains can make us bad investors

Cognitive biases can nudge us toward certain behaviours without us even realizing it. In this video, we‚Äôll explore common cognitive biases, how they could impact our investing decisions, and what we should know to help us become better investors.
Watch now

Let‚Äôs talk money: A practical guide for families
Money often plays a key role across different generations‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs parents supporting their children through major life milestones, adults helping aging parents, or siblings navigating the complexities of an inheritance. We explore why open and honest conversations about finances are so important.
Read more

Additional resources for you.
Looking for more DIY investor support?
Follow our TD Direct Investing Instagram account.
Elevate your investing IQ and subscribe to our TD Direct Investing YouTube channel.
See how you’re trending with other self-directed investors using the TD Direct Investing Index.
Need to access your account statements?
You can find them in WebBroker.
Need account or platform answers fast?
Visit our help centre.
Contact Us  |  Privacy and Security  |  Legal
 
Safeguarding our customers' information is a fundamental principle of TD Bank Group. For security reasons, certain information including account number has been masked. TD will not ask you to provide personal information or login information, such as username, passwords, PINs, IdentificationPlus® security questions and answers or account numbers, through unsolicited email. TD will not share sensitive data through regular email nor will TD request this type of information be sent from you through regular email. If you suspect an email to be fraudulent, please forward a copy to us at phishing@td.com and then delete the email.

TD Direct Investing is a division of TD Waterhouse Canada Inc., a subsidiary of The Toronto‑Dominion Bank. TD Waterhouse Canada Inc. ‚Äì Member of the Canadian Investor Protection Fund.

® The TD logo and other TD trademarks are the property of The Toronto‑Dominion Bank or its subsidiaries.

 
You have received this email at matthew@levinelegal.ca because you are a client of TD Direct Investing. To ensure delivery to your inbox (and not to your junk or bulk mail folders), add email@e.email-td.com to your address book.

If you wish to stop receiving commercial electronic messages from TD Direct Investing, please unsubscribe or go to the following web address: td.com/tddirectinvestingunsubscribe.

Please do not reply to this email ‚Äì this mailbox is not monitored.

 
TD Direct Investing
P.O. Box 5999, Station F
77 Bloor Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M4Y 2T1

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew Thanks for letting me know,,yes please ASAP.Sadly,,lot of bills are waiting to be paid.Whatever works the fastest.Just a suggestion,you can send a certified check by UPS,or I can pick it up,
emails.body:
Hi Matthew

Thanks for letting me know,,yes please ASAP.Sadly,,lot of bills are waiting to be paid.Whatever works the fastest.Just a suggestion,you can send a certified check by UPS,or I can pick it up, but of course I will wait to hear what your options are and we will go from there.Again hope to hear something from you ASAP..
Matthew,I would also like to say, I apologize for my impatience..

Thanks

Zeljko

Sent from my Huawei phone


-------- Original message --------
From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
Date: Mon., Feb. 9, 2026, 3:07 p.m.
To: Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: 1716867 Ontario Inc. - Shareholders
Hi Zeljko

It appears that there was an issue with BMO (my bank) and the payment did not get processed. The funds remain in my trust account. I will follow up about our options for getting the funds to you. 


Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.  




On Mon, Feb 9, 2026 at 2:37‚ÄØPM Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Matthew 

Just quickly, just talked to the bank,,they said they have not received, or see any transfer of funds into my account.Hopefully you can check on your end, to see if there was an error made, concerning the transfer of the funds.
    I'm sure it's all fine, and like you said it might take a day or two, for the transfer to happen,,,but also it's good to double check..As soon as the funds have been deposited into my account,I will let you know.

Thanks 

Zeljko 

On Mon., Feb. 9, 2026, 12:48 p.m. Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Matthew 

Just wanted to let you know the funds have not been deposited into my account yet.
    The RBC financial advisor just emailed me, to let me know, the funds are not there yet.We had a meeting at 1-00.. 
     Hopefully the funds will come later today or tomorrow.I will keep you posted,and let you know as soon as the funds have been deposited into my account.

Thanks 

Zeljko 
    

On Fri., Feb. 6, 2026, 4:44 p.m. Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca> wrote:
Hi Zeljko

I am confirming that the funds have been sent. It may not arrive today but please let me know when it does arrive.

Ill follow up next week and yes we will discuss the capital gains. 


Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.  




On Thu, Feb 5, 2026 at 3:54‚ÄØPM Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Matthew,

Thank you for the great news.
Please let me know once the funds have been transfered.Attached is the information you need.

Looking forward to discussing the other matters (capital gains) once this it's all done.

Talk soon. Thank you,
Zeljko

Sent from my Huawei phone


-------- Original message --------
From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
Date: Thu., Feb. 5, 2026, 2:51 p.m.
To: Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: 1716867 Ontario Inc. - Shareholders
Hi Zeljko

I have received the funds. I will transfer them to you. 

Please give me your bank account info. Also, pls share a copy of your drivers license for my records.  

Best regards
Matthew

Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.  




On Fri, Jan 30, 2026 at 12:35‚ÄØAM Zelko Culibrk <zeeculibrk@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Matthew

Thanks for the update..The important thing for us is,, that she and her lawyer know that we accept her offer,, and you confirmed that's been done..Now I guess we have to wait for her lawyer, hopefully not for long.
If Mr.Rogers is unavailable to close the deal,, hopefully one of his coligs ,another lawyer,can finish this.We don't want to wait long either, she gave us 4-5 days and wanted a quick response,,we did that..All side's want to finish this,hopefully,ASAP, and move on.There is not much left to do,we agreed to the offer,we signed the papers, and now the only thing left is the transfer of the funds to us, that's it,I think .
Matthew, as soon as you hear something, please let us know.
Thanks
Zeljko

Resources to Help You Sell Successfully

Selling a business takes more than just a listing. These free resources are here to help you prepare your sale and market your business with confidence.

Guide to Selling Your Business

Want to dive deep? This guide includes essential steps and toolkits to navigate your sale.

Access the guide here

BizWorth Calculator

Wondering what your business is worth? Get a quick estimate in minutes.

Try the BizWorth calculator

 

Business Benchmark

See how your business stacks up against others with this quick snapshot.

Get your benchmark

Video Center

Prefer to watch and learn? Our video series explains the selling process in a clear and visual way.

Visit the Video Center

No matter where you are in your selling journey, these resources can help you get the maximum value for your business.
Need help from an expert?

You can connect with experienced business brokers on BizBuySell. From marketing to managing paperwork and buyer conversations, a broker helps streamline the process while you keep running your business.
Visit The Learning Center

Everything you need to sell with confidence.

 

Questions? We're here to help.

Contact us at (888) 777-9893 Monday - Friday (8 AM EST to 8 PM EST), or email membership@bizbuysell.com.

emails.snippet: That is email I want to share with you Sent from my iPhone Begin forwarded message: From: Kristi Kanitz <kristi@flagshipsoftware.com> Date: February 7, 2026 at 12:29:26 PM EST To: marjan
emails.body:
That is email I want to share with you
Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Kristi Kanitz <kristi@flagshipsoftware.com>
Date: February 7, 2026 at 12:29:26‚ÄØPM EST
To: marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>
Subject: Questions to ask the lawyer:

Ôªø 1. Did you purchase the shares of the business or the assets?

2. What does the sale agreement say about the current employees?

Find out from the previous owner:  Did the current people that work there sign employment contracts? If so, where are the contracts?

3. Should you have the current employees sign new employment agreements? If so, what consideration should be offered (you have to give them something to get them to sign)? Keep in mind that even signing the new agreement doesn't mean they start a probationary period.

Find out how long each of the employees has been there. That will tell you what kind of severance you will be responsible for if you decide to terminate them.

Kristi

--
[Flagship Software Logo]        Kristi Kanitz
General Manager

Kristi@flagshipsoftware.com <mailto:Kristi@flagshipsoftware.com>
www.flagshipsoftware.com <https://www.flagshipsoftware.com/>

416‚Äë410‚Äë6357 / 1‚Äë866‚Äë672‚Äë0007 ext 102

Hi Matthew
I hope you are doing well I am so confused to know what I do with this woman we want to find a solution with out paying her but I don‚Äôt know if that is possible in the  mean time Allen worry about she have good relationships with previous owners and she goes around to bad mouth us and cause problems. We are really in very bad places want to fire her but we try to do it smart way.  I don‚Äôt know if is any smart way.
So in mean time I talk with my  friend she have business she send me emails I would like to share it with you she ask me to ask lawyer those questions.
Thank you
Marjan

On Feb 6, 2026, at 10:19‚ÄØAM, Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca<mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>> wrote:

Ôªø
Hi Marjan

My recommended approach is to

  *   investigate and identify how the business came to be responsible for this woman;
  *   work with you to finalize and implement replacing her; and,
  *   determine whether some or all of the costs can be recuperated from the former business owner.

The standard process is that my firm will collect a trust deposit.

I can talk this afternoon at, say, 2 or 3 pm. Do either of those times work for you?


Matthew AJ Levine
Barrister & Solicitor

On Fri, Feb 6, 2026 at 10:03‚ÄØAM marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>> wrote:
Please let me know any advice you can give me what is right thing to do.
Thank you

On Feb 5, 2026, at 9:17‚ÄØPM, marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>> wrote:

Ôªø
Hello
We did the 70,000 franchise fee as payment for the franchise. While we where looking for a site his Growing minds became for sale and the owner of the franchise said it would be good to take Growing minds and change it to Uptown Montessori under the franchise name. I believed him and he did all the disclosure and discover on his end. The Supervisor was running the day to day operations and was told I needed to keep her and the staff they had. A week after we toke over we she demanded a big raise from 60k a year 5 days a week to almost 70k a year only working 4 days a week. She was holding all the information that ran the business and I was informed to take her deal and then find a way to get her out rhe door in a few months. Right now I do not feel welcome their and I do not want to even show up. I know on paper it's my business but to me it feels like it's hers not mine
Marjan



Sent from Outlook<http://aka.ms/weboutlook>

________________________________
From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca<mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>>
Sent: February 5, 2026 11:09 AM
To: marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>>
Subject: Re: Corporate Law Firm

Hi Marjan

Good day. I have the FDD, thank you.

At a preliminary level, I have questions about how the transaction was structured, particularly in relation to the franchise agreement that was entered into and the fee that was paid. To start with, can you confirm whether a $70,000 initial franchise fee was paid, and whether you were given an explanation at the time for why the transaction was treated as a new franchise rather than a transfer or change of control?

Before I can assess whether there is a legal issue to be examined, it would be helpful to make sure I understand the situation from your perspective. In particular:

  *   What concern or issue prompted you to reach out now?

  *   Who was responsible for day-to-day management of the business at the time of the transaction, and how was that role described to you?

  *   Were you told that any individual‚Äôs continued involvement was expected or required when the deal was completed?

The reason I ask is that issues involving disclosure and transaction structure are treated differently from operational or personnel disputes, and I want to be clear on the factual background.

Once I have that context, we can discuss whether there is a legal issue worth pursuing and what the appropriate next steps might be.

Best regards



Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor

I don‚Äôt know you received the documents  you miss, I am more than happy to send it again, but one person I want to get her out her name is Shannon Groop and her name is not in document. I don‚Äôt want that she be there I want to know what is best opportunity that be helping me.
Thank you

From: Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca<mailto:matthew@levinelegal.ca>>
Sent: February 4, 2026 12:33 AM
To: marjan banisaeed <mbanisaeed@hotmail.com<mailto:mbanisaeed@hotmail.com>>
Subject: Re: Corporate Law Firm

Hi Marjan

I've not looked at everything and this is not legal advice.

I believe there should be a third document titled the Franchise Disclosure Document or FDD. Do you have that?

Overall, I wonder if the problem is about the business or if it is, at the end day, driven by this particular individual. How would you describe the problem in your own words? If it is about the individual specifically, then it is essential to understand the legal relationship between her and the company. Is she one of the five people mentioned in the share purchase agreement, what is her name, is there a contract between her and the business?

Pls let me know!



Matthew AJ Levine

Barrister & Solicitor

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, 1. That makes sense I was thinking whoever needs to create the task can do it under the section but I agree user-wise that would create unnecessary work when they can just pick it from the
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,

1. That makes sense I was thinking whoever needs to create the task can do
it under the section but I agree user-wise that would create unnecessary
work when they can just pick it from the field. I can absolutely create
that automation!

2. Asana doesn't have an automation where the subtasks change based on the
section the task is moved into. We can do this:
- *Option 1:* We create one task template per section (each with its own
subtasks) and set a rule that when task is moved to Section X ‚Üí Convert
task to Template X. However, this overwrites the task with the template and
it will delete the comments, attachments, or custom progress.

- *Option 2:* We create one master task, have all possible subtasks once
(as we have now), group subtasks by color or prefix:

üü¶ - Onboarding
üü© - Opening
üü® - Maintenance

Sample subtask:

üü¶ DRAFT: Engagement Agreement
üü¶ CONFIRM: Engagement Agreement Stored in Clio

3. Sorry abt this, I thought whoever's handling Intake has their own board.
Let me know if this is something that we need in the future!

Kindly let me know your thoughts. Thanks!

emails.body:
Hi Matthew

Just quickly, just talked to the bank,,they said they have not received, or
see any transfer of funds into my account.Hopefully you can check on
your end, to see if there was an error made, concerning the transfer of the
funds.
    I'm sure it's all fine, and like you said it might take a day or two,
for the transfer to happen,,,but also it's good to double check..As soon as
the funds have been deposited into my account,I will let you know.

Thanks

Zeljko

emails.snippet: Hi LIno 1. Got it, I think we can delete the Fulfillment Stage column since we have them as Sections already deleting the fulfillment stage column seems fine. but, i believe there needs to be a field
emails.body:
Hi LIno

1. Got it, I think we can delete the Fulfillment Stage column since we have
them as Sections already

deleting the fulfillment stage column seems fine. but, i believe there
needs to be a field so that hte Fulfillment Stage can be set.  how about
some sort of automation whereby:


   1. human being sets the fulfillment stage field, card is moved to the
   relevant section.
   2. once card is moved to any particular section, the sub-task(s) for
   that section are populated?
      1. to be frank, im not sure that every single sub-task in the SOP
      needs to be an Asana sub-task. we can discuss this point.


2. I can rename it as that, just for consistency kindly name the other
Boards like Intake Tracker for consistency

so, i am open to that. what board are you talking about? is there a
specific "Intake" board at this stage?



*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor


This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.

emails.snippet: Hi Matthew, Have looked into the government funding and seems that anything that's available is for large companies and the loan amounts are aggressive. Do you have any ideas? Max Hill, CET Mascore
emails.body:
Hi Matthew,



Have looked into the government funding and seems that anything that‚Äôs
available is for large companies and the loan amounts are aggressive.



Do you have any ideas?



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Monday, February 9, 2026 12:15 PM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project





Hey Max



When you have time, please let me know where things are at on your side and
any additional info I can informally review.



I would be confident in working on the government funding.





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Mon, Jan 12, 2026 at 12:11‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

I haven‚Äôt looked into the grant money that would be available for this but
will.



I would need some time to think about this.



Have been thinking of ways to create a product that is new and novel and
believe we have some decent idea.



You plan is great.



Give me some time to look into grant money. Please do not work on this
anymore until I get back to you.



I have enough info to push this forward for now.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Monday, January 12, 2026 12:06 PM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project



Hi Max



the patent lawyers who I know best are litigators but I do know some people
who do product development and will reach out.



I believe there may be government money available - have you looked into
that at all?



I see the next steps as:

   - *1. Legal Scoping*: counsel reviews the existing (U.S.) patent and
   scopes a design mandate focused on avoiding infringement under Canadian
   law. The scope and cost of this work will depend whether the goal is:


   - (a) to avoid infringing the existing patent (i.e., design-around), or
      - (b) to create something patentable by Mascore itself (i.e.,
      inventive and novel under the *Patent Act*).


   - *2 ‚Äì Technical Development*: The product designer works within
   specified parameters to generate technical outputs, i.e. designs, models,
   and prototypes to achieve (a) or (b)
   - *3 ‚Äì Legal Review*: counsel reviews the technical outputs and provides
   a follow-up opinion or informal assessment confirming whether the resulting
   design achieves (a) or (b)
   - *4 ‚Äì Filing & Prosecution (if pursuing a patent strategy)*: If the
   objective under Step 1 includes creating patentable subject matter, a
   separate workstream is initiated for preparation and prosecution of
   Mascore‚Äôs own patent application.

what do you think of the above?











*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Fri, Jan 9, 2026 at 12:30‚ÄØPM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

There is a US company that owns a patent on a unique deep foundation
product.



It is technically a helical pile, but it is modified and has a continuous
flight added to it that pull down concrete during installation making the
foundation much stronger. Attached is the brochure for reference.



Also attached is the Canadian and US patent.



My thoughts are:



   - The patent drawing is technically different from what they actually
   produce, although similar. The patent shows a helical shape plate with 2-3
   revolution where what they actually build is a single revolution helix
   plate.
   - We build a similar product already without a helix plate. See attached
   drawing.
   - Need to figure out a way to prove this isn‚Äôt ‚Äúnovel‚Äù
   - What type of modification can we make to it to make our own novelty?
   - An American company produces this and has plans to bring it to Canada.
   We‚Äôd like to stop this by competing with it.



I understand you earn a patent lawyer, but do you have any contacts?



Please let us know your thoughts.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389



*From:* Matthew Levine <matthew@levinelegal.ca>
*Sent:* Friday, January 9, 2026 11:11 AM
*To:* Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca>
*Subject:* Re: New Project



Hi Max



very interested. please send more info.



(i'm not a patent lawyer, as you know.)



happy new year





*Matthew AJ* *Levine*

Barrister & Solicitor



This message may contain confidential and / or privileged information and
is only to be used by the intended recipient. If you received this message
in error, please delete it and notify us. Thank you.







On Thu, Jan 8, 2026 at 9:12‚ÄØAM Max Hill <mhill@mascore.ca> wrote:

HI Matthew,



Hope you are well.



I have a new project I am working on that involved patent expertise.



There is an existing product in our market that we would like to start
offering that is patented.



We would like to build a similar product without infringing or having
ourselves covered in the event of a legal action.



Is this something you can help us with?



If so, I will provide further details.



Max Hill, C.E.T

Mascore Helical Piles

905-807-4389
